name: Looking for a pvp build | Level cap 1 to 40
author: Cutieddu

posts.author: Cutieddu
posts.content:
Hello everyone.
congratulations for this forum , really interesting .
Thanks for your attention. 

I'm looking for a PVP build for a server lvl 40 RPG/oriented.

I have no preferences about Class.
The only rule of the game is that you can not change classes without first 3 of the same class. 
For Example:
Fighter
Fighter
Fighter
(now you can change)
Rogue
Rogue
Rogue
(now you can change)
Shadowdancer.

So here we are:
1) PvP - Build
2) Level cap - 1 to 40
3) Race preference - I dont wanna if possible, Dwarf or Halfling. I Prefer Human, or Elf, or Drow.
4) Class preference - No preference, just only NO MONK.


Thank you very much, and sorry for my english. :)

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
We need more information:
Do you want a caster type or fighter type?
If a caster, buffer or offensive?
If a fighter type, melee, archer, or stealthy?
Are any spells or feats modified or disabled, like Devastating Critical?
Are any classes restricted, nerfed, or hard to get, like Red Dragon Disciple?
What kind of items are available, high magic or low magic?
Somebody else might have more questions. With these questions answered, a build can be made that is just right for you.

posts.author: Cutieddu
posts.content:
Ok.. i prefer Fighter type, love Stealthy, like Assassin. But no Halfling.
No spell modification. Dev Crit is enable.
Yes for restriction class. The monk is prohibited. Only pure Monk.
The item are High Magic. Many Casts are not permanent like Velocity, and the shield of Sorcerer are not permitted all together. Only one at a time.

I have not really preferences. I like Sorcerer, Cleric, assassins or rogue too.
I'd like a nice Build Construction for pvp, according to your gaming experience.

Thank you so much for your reply.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
How about a Fighter / Bard / Weapon Master with Dev Crit on his scimitar?
How about a Fighter / Bard / RDD with Dev Crit on his dual kukris?
How about a stealthy Rogue / Fighter / Shadowdancer with Epic Dodge?
If one or more of these look good to you, let me know and I'll build it.
Somebody else could probably make you a better Sorcerer, Cleric, or Assassin.

posts.content:

How about a Fighter / Bard / Weapon Master with Dev Crit on his scimitar?

 
Thank you Empire 65 for you fast reply!
Oh, love this build, looks like a Pirate in RPG. Ok for this. Is a Fighter in Full Plate?

Maybe someone can build a Cleric too.
Thank you!

posts.content:

Thank you Empire 65 for you fast reply!
Oh, love this build, looks like a Pirate in RPG. Ok for this. Is a Fighter in Full Plate?

Maybe someone can build a Cleric too.
Thank you!
 
I'm not a PvP specialist, but generally in high-magic settings, Clerics lose a bit for being self-buffers with buffs capping at +5, but if you really want one, I would refer you to two of my builds: The Shadow Priest and Demolition Man. Depending on the server customization, these builds are the ones that have the most potential for PvP.

But as I said, I'm not a specialist.

OOPS, just saw, no Monks. Dammit! lol

Then you should probably try Mith's Blood & Faith

P.S.: The build names are links, but because of the forum colors you may not have noticed them.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Cutieddu
posts.content:
Thank you so Much Maximiliam Kane.
Nice build, but the only problem is at level 22. I can change in RDD because i need another 2 lvl of same class Bard.
Unfortunately is the rule of this shard... but thank you very much. I love it.

Now look the Fighter build of Empyre65.

Thank you. U r very kind.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
How "High" a magic Level are we talking about? Are there immunities to items that will prevent Knockdown/ Sneaks/ Critical Hits? What is the Enchantment you typically find on the PvP builds at Lvl 40?

The higher you go in the "Magic Scale" the more Dexterity-based Characters are favoured.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Cutieddu wrote:
Thank you so Much Maximiliam Kane.
Nice build, but the only problem is at level 22. I can change in RDD because i need another 2 lvl of same class Bard.
Unfortunately is the rule of this shard... but thank you very much. I love it.

Now look the Fighter build of Empyre65.

Thank you. U r very kind.
You need to tweak it a little, take 3 bard levels straight, but the build is 26/4/10 so you can do it. At 22, 23 and 24 you take Bard, then at 37 or 38 again for the last skill dump.

posts.author: Cutieddu
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
How "High" a magic Level are we talking about? Are there immunities to items that will prevent Knockdown/ Sneaks/ Critical Hits? NOPE
The higher you go in the "Magic Scale" the more Dexterity-based Characters are favoured. YES, DEX ORIENTED ARE VERY GOOD BUILD IN THIS SHARD, BUT IS NOT THE PRIORITY.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: If there are no items that confer crit. immunity and if there are no alignment restrictions on your server, and if dexterity isn't a priority (those are quite a few if's), then a (Paladin 26/ Bard 4/ RDD 10) w/ scimitar & shield plus dev. critical, should be the best or one of the best warriors all-around. Ignorinbg charisma all-together, going full strength and for dev. critical this Paladin can have over 70 AB buffed, with over 50 DC for your Devastating Critical and will brutalize every encounter you will come to know. It has also a very good AC which will be a net 36 without magic items and various immunities through his spells and he is undispellable except from Mord's. In a few words, a Beast.

posts.author: Cutieddu
posts.content: Thank you so much Valerfor, very powerful build, but have one problem. Alignment change. In this shard is possible only in RPG/Quest with DM.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Aye, the builds posted before need to change a bit so that can fit into the regulations of his server, but that's easy. And i see lot's of builds here, with quite big numbers and all the bells and whistles, but i have yet to see a PvP build. Cutieddu asked for a PvP build first and these aren't going to cut it. Where are the save boosters guys, or do you think that your build will be the only one with Devastating Critical and a Scimitar? The first (Ftr/CoT/Wm) you are going to face, will eat you alive, and that's a build from 2004 (primeval champion) and i won't make any reference yet to Imploders or Assassin's. While all of your builds are wonderfully planned and very aggressive, you lack defenses. And forget about two-handed weapons, Scythes-or-not, this isn't WoG where there are "Shield Bracers" to give you back some of the lost AC, and in a high magic world that AC might be easily 13 whole points of AC for a shield +10. Pretty much you need a scimitar & shield set-up and all of the fortitude save boosters (luck of heroes, great fortitude & epic fortitude) to have a chance to not only deliver, but withstand the enemies save-or-die attacks, be it wails, implosions, assassinations or devastating hits.

Here is an example, although this might not cut it, i used Max's Dwarven build as a base.

posts.author: Cutieddu
posts.content:
Cutieddu wrote:
The only rule of the game is that you can not change classes without first 3 of the same class. 

 
Looks Nice build, but i can't use in my server.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Look, you can, but you will need to alter the leveling order a bit. It has 14 Fighter levels, 19 Rogue levels and 7 Weapon Master levels. This is called tweaking and it's something we all do when we adjust a build to play in a module or server. In my server, for example, Clerics have Domain Restrictions, so I can't play my Clerics the way I build them. I change the domains according to the god I will serve and just live with it.

Take Rogue at levels 1, 2 and 3, then the 4th Rogue at 17, then Fighter at 4, 5, 6 and 7 and you're free to take WM (which you will take consecutively too) as soon as you meet the requirements, I don't see a problem. It requires minor tweaks, delaying a couple of feats, and that's all. The number of feats is the same, the levels of each class are the same, etc.. All you need to do is play around with the order and choose which feats you will delay

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Nice build Empyre,
just a couple of thoughts..

a) You might want to make this a Dwarf instead of a Human, one less feat means no exotic weapons
b) Take a rapier & buckler, this will reasult in +2 AB/ +8 AC, w/ same critical range
c) Redo your skills with focus more on PvP, i don't see Spellcraft there at all, but i see huge scores in open locks, search and disable traps. You have Spot maxed-out which is good at least.
d) Replace two great dex feats with epic fortitude and esf: discipline. Also change class order and take epic prowess along with last fighter level at the end in order to max discipline. You lose 1 AB/ AC here but you will be much safer.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
a) He said on the first page that he didn't want a Dwarf. Choosing Dwarf instead of Human woud gain you +2 CON, but at a great cost: you lose 2 CHA, which is useful for UMD, you lose a feat, and you lose a skill.
b) He said he didn't want to use a shield, and also dual wielding kukris + Haste gives you 7 attacks per round, which means 3 in the first flurry, which means more sneak attacks when coming out of hiding.
c) I had left out Discipline, figuring that with such low STR, your Discipline wouldn't wave you from Knockdown anyway, and I left out Spellcraft because I didn't have enough skill points left over, and in a high-magic world, you can reach your +20 max on saves bonuses with gear alone. I know I have in Sands of Fate.
d) I don't like losing AB and AC, but OK. In the new versions below, I put the last Fighter level at 39 so I could max several Rogue skills, but still almost max Discipline.

Here's a vesion that takes your advice from points c) and d). I rearranged some points in the abilities so I could add another skill for Discipline. I can live with bashing locks, like in the build I am playing now, but I don't like the idea of a Rogue that clumsily sets off traps.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Cutieddu wrote:
Thank you so much for the build!
My definitively choice is Sneaky Stabber 2! :) Love it.
I have a question for you Empire. Is the Same thing if i pick 3 level of Shadowdancer before 20?

Thank you to all . You have been very kind and patient .
No, you can pick multiples of 4 of Rogue and Shadowdancer. So you can remove 4 Rogue levels for 4 Shadowdancer levels if you want, pre-epic without issues. Read my Complete Guide to the Basics of Building in the Game Guides section for you to understand BAB progressions and the "rule of 4"

Enjoy!
